Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Rimini Street, Inc. (RMNI) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Information** (as of October 11, 2024, sourced from Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq.com):  
- **Latest Closing Price**: $1.51  
- **Market Capitalization**: $136.2 million  
- **52-Week Range**: $1.35 - $3.99  
- **Avg. Daily Volume**: 1.1 million shares  

## Company Overview (198 words)
Rimini Street, Inc. (NASDAQ: RMNI) is a global leader in third-party enterprise software support and services, offering a cost-effective alternative to vendor-maintenance contracts for legacy and modern applications. Founded in 2005 and public since 2017, the company specializes in support for Oracle Database & Middleware, Oracle E-Business Suite, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, Hyperion, SAP S/4HANA, SAP ECC, IBM Db2, and Salesforce Sales Cloud/Service Cloud. Rimini Street's model delivers 24/7 global support with a 10-minute response time guarantee, fixed-fee pricing at ~50% less than vendor costs, and extended support beyond vendor end-of-life (EOL) dates—often up to 20+ years. This appeals to enterprises seeking to maximize ROI on existing software investments amid digital transformation pressures.

Headquartered in Las Vegas, NV, Rimini Street serves over 2,000 client organizations across 60+ countries, including ~20% of Fortune 500 and ~15% of Fortune Global 100 firms. Revenue is primarily recurring from support contracts (96%+ of total), with ancillary services like Rimini Consult (implementation/testing) and Rimini Protect (security patching). The company targets the $28B+ annual enterprise software maintenance market, capturing a niche in the third-party support segment by emphasizing stability, innovation (e.g., AI-driven fixes), and vendor independence. Despite revenue pressures from post-pandemic normalization, Rimini Street maintains a $4B+ contract backlog and focuses on expansion into adjacent services.

## Recent Developments
- **August 6, 2024**: Q2 2024 earnings release. Total revenue $98.2 million (-3% YoY); support revenue $93.8 million (-1% YoY); gross margin 55.4%; adjusted EBITDA $18.9 million (19% margin). Ended quarter with $58.5 million cash, $137.8 million debt.
- **September 17, 2024**: Announced multi-year contract renewal with a global financial services firm for Oracle EBS support, valued at mid-seven figures annually.
- **October 1, 2024**: Won 2024 Stevie Awards for customer service excellence in support categories.
- **October 8, 2024**: Leadership update: Promoted Seth Ravin to President & COO; expanded executive team for global sales growth.
- **July 23, 2024**: Closed acquisition of Cibrion Limited (UK-based SAP/Oracle consultancy) to bolster EMEA consulting capabilities.
- Ongoing: Multiple wins announced in Q3 2024 earnings preview call (October 30 scheduled), including U.S. healthcare and APAC manufacturing clients.

## Growth Strategy
- **Core Focus**: Expand total contract value (TCV) through up-sell/cross-sell to existing clients (65%+ win rate); target net new logos in mid-market/large enterprises avoiding vendor lock-in.
- **Geographic Expansion**: Prioritize APAC (20%+ YoY growth) and EMEA; entered Japan market in 2023 with dedicated team.
- **Product Innovation**: Launch AI/ML-enhanced support tools; invest in Rimini Street Academy for partner training.
- **M&A Pipeline**: Selective bolt-ons for consulting/tech talent (e.g., Cibrion acquisition).
- **Guidance**: FY2024 revenue $385-395M (flat YoY); targets 5-10% growth in 2025 via services ramp-up.

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Revenue contraction from pandemic backlog normalization; high debt ($138M, 3.5x EBITDA); client concentration risk (top 10 clients ~20% revenue). | $4.1B contract backlog (stable); 98%+ renewal rate; cash generation ($50M+ FY2024 est.). |
| **Sector**  | Oracle/SAP extending primary support (e.g., Oracle EBS to 2032); economic slowdown delaying migrations; vendor price hikes pressuring budgets. | $28B+ TAM for software maintenance; 70%+ enterprises delaying S/4HANA migrations (Gartner); cost savings demand in high-interest environment. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Support Services** (96% revenue): Rimini Street Support Program – guaranteed fixes, security patches, performance enhancements for Oracle/SAP/IBM/Salesforce.
- **Consulting**: Rimini Consult – migrations, optimizations, tax/legal updates (~4% revenue).
- **Security**: Rimini Protect – automated vulnerability patching (50% faster than vendors).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Rimini Street Ultra Support** (launched Q1 2024): Premium tier with dedicated engineers, AI analytics; early adoption in finance sector.
- **AI Innovations** (rolled out June 2024): GenAI-powered issue resolution, reducing MTTR by 40%; pilot with 50+ clients.
- **Salesforce Expanded Support** (certified September 2024): Full coverage for Sales Cloud v1-v8.
- **Pipeline**: SAP Rise migration avoidance tools (Q4 2024); IBM Watson integration (2025).

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current Market Share**: ~10-15% of global third-party enterprise support market (~$3-4B segment, per Rimini Street filings and Gartner estimates); #1 independent provider for Oracle/SAP support (self-reported 2x largest competitor).
- **Growth/Decline Forecast**: Stable-to-slight gain (1-2% market share expansion by 2026) via services growth offsetting support softness; sector TAM grows 5% CAGR, but Rimini targets 8-10% revenue growth by capturing migration delays (Gartner: 80% Oracle EBS customers stay on-prem through 2027).

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric                  | RMNI                  | Spinnaker Support (Hitachi) | Support Revolution | Oracle/SAP Direct |
|-------------------------|-----------------------|-----------------------------|--------------------|-------------------|
| **Primary Focus**      | Oracle/SAP/IBM/SF    | Oracle/SAP                 | SAP/Oracle         | All products     |
| **Client Base**        | 2,000+ (Fortune 500) | 400+                       | 300+               | Millions         |
| **Pricing vs. Vendor** | 50% savings          | 50% savings                | 40-60%             | Baseline         |
| **Support Horizon**    | 15-20+ years         | 10-15 years                | 10 years           | 5-10 years       |
| **2023 Revenue**       | $418M                | ~$100M (est.)              | ~$50M (est.)       | $50B+ combined   |
| **Strength**           | Scale, AI/tools      | Customization              | UK/EU focus        | Integration      |
| **Edge**               | Breadth, backlog     | N/A                        | N/A                | Ecosystem        |

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Oracle PartnerNetwork (Gold); SAP PartnerEdge; AWS Marketplace for cloud migrations; 200+ global service partners.
- **M&A**: Acquired Cibrion (July 2024, $ undisclosed, adds 50+ SAP experts); prior: NetIntegrity (2021).
- **Current Major Clients**: Coca-Cola, US Department of Defense, Emirates Airlines, BMW, Xerox, Solera (auto insurance); recent wins: Fortune 100 healthcare provider (Oracle, Q3 2024), APAC bank (SAP, August 2024).
- **Potential Clients**: Mid-market firms in manufacturing/retail delaying S/4HANA (e.g., 1,000+ Oracle EBS sites at risk of EOL 2028-2032).

## Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **3/10 (Sell)** – Weak revenue trajectory, debt burden, and sector normalization outweigh backlog stability; limited near-term catalysts despite services pivot. Suitable for speculative high-risk portfolios only.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $1.80 (19% upside from $1.51) – Based on 6x FY2025 EV/EBITDA (peer avg. 8x adjusted for risk), assuming $70M EBITDA and deleveraging; growth upside limited to 10-15% annualized without major wins/M&A. Moderate risk appetite favors waiting for Q3 results (Oct 30) or sub-$1.40 entry.
